article.p: Welcome to gamelab, a web application for online game theory experiments. Gamelab allows you to configure two-player normal-form games for play over the Internet. Participants accumulate tickets from their payoffs against the average play. At the end of the experiment, these tickets may be used in a lottery drawing to select winners.

Gamelab was developed for Jörgen Weibull with financial support from the Knut and Alice Wallenberg Research Foundation. The project was designed by Eskil Forsell and Jörgen Weibull, and implemented by Kristaps Dzonsons.

section.p: If you're interested in deploying a gamelab server of your own, consult the manual on how to download, install, and administer experiments. However, we're still getting the source code ship-shape: if you want to use it, please contact us for a copy. Otherwise, if you're interested in teaming up, or just want to share your experiences, contact Jörgen, Kristaps, or Eskil. In the spirit of academic sharing, gamelab is open source, and we kindly suggest that experimenters cite our work!
